title: Weekend merit badge presentations — Programming, AI, Cybersecurity
description: Host three BSA merit badge teaching sessions on GitHub Pages using reveal.js. Badges: Programming (https://www.scouting.org/merit-badges/programming/), Artificial Intelligence (https://www.scouting.org/merit-badges/artificial-intelligence/), Cybersecurity (https://www.scouting.org/merit-badges/cybersecurity/). Due this weekend.

title: Fetch Programming merit badge requirements from scouting.org
description: Scrape/fetch the official requirements from https://www.scouting.org/merit-badges/programming/ and save as structured source material. Capture all requirement numbers, sub-requirements, and any notes or clarifications listed on the page.

title: Fetch Artificial Intelligence merit badge requirements from scouting.org
description: Scrape/fetch the official requirements from https://www.scouting.org/merit-badges/artificial-intelligence/ and save as structured source material. Capture all requirement numbers, sub-requirements, and any notes or clarifications listed on the page.

title: Fetch Cybersecurity merit badge requirements from scouting.org
description: Scrape/fetch the official requirements from https://www.scouting.org/merit-badges/cybersecurity/ and save as structured source material. Capture all requirement numbers, sub-requirements, and any notes or clarifications listed on the page.

title: Set up common reveal.js rendering pipeline
description: Design and scaffold the shared reveal.js presentation infrastructure. Decide on: directory layout (e.g. badges/programming/, badges/ai/, badges/cybersecurity/), shared theme/CSS, whether to use reveal.js as a git submodule or CDN, common slide template structure (title slide, requirement slides, activity slides). Document the conventions in a README.

title: Set up GitHub Actions to publish to GitHub Pages
description: Create a GitHub Actions workflow that builds and deploys the reveal.js presentations to GitHub Pages on push to main. Should handle: triggering on push, configuring the gh-pages branch or docs/ folder, ensuring all three badge presentations are accessible at predictable URLs (e.g. /programming/, /ai/, /cybersecurity/).

title: Map Programming merit badge requirements to reveal.js markdown slides
description: Convert the fetched Programming merit badge requirements into a reveal.js presentation using the common pipeline. Each top-level requirement gets its own section. Sub-requirements become bullet slides or activity slides. Include a title slide, agenda, and a 'what you need to show your counselor' summary slide at the end. Output: badges/programming/index.html (or index.md if using markdown plugin).

title: Map Artificial Intelligence merit badge requirements to reveal.js markdown slides
description: Convert the fetched Artificial Intelligence merit badge requirements into a reveal.js presentation using the common pipeline. Each top-level requirement gets its own section. Sub-requirements become bullet slides or activity slides. Include a title slide, agenda, and a 'what you need to show your counselor' summary slide at the end. Output: badges/ai/index.html.

title: Map Cybersecurity merit badge requirements to reveal.js markdown slides
description: Convert the fetched Cybersecurity merit badge requirements into a reveal.js presentation using the common pipeline. Each top-level requirement gets its own section. Sub-requirements become bullet slides or activity slides. Include a title slide, agenda, and a 'what you need to show your counselor' summary slide at the end. Output: badges/cybersecurity/index.html.

title: Add viral Pope deepfake image to 5a Deepfakes slide
description:
Add the famous 2023 viral AI-generated image of Pope Francis in a Balenciaga puffer coat to the deepfakes slide (5a) as a concrete, recognizable real-world example.

Image URL: https://assets1.cbsnewsstatic.com/hub/i/r/2023/03/28/fabd7f51-3635-4172-8d82-29eb27691013/thumbnail/1240x780g2/cd8b154b1e8cf23be7e82397ad721da7/960x0.jpg

Implementation notes:
- Add as an inline image on the 5a 'What Is a Deepfake?' slide or its own sub-slide
- Include caption: 'AI-generated image of Pope Francis, 2023 — fooled millions'
- This image went viral and is widely used in AI literacy education
- Use the .cols layout to pair image with key points
- Keep it impactful — let the image speak first, then explain

title: Add QR codes to main index linking to each merit badge
description:
Add QR codes to the main index.html page (https://kwv.github.io/advancement-university/) so counselors and scouts can quickly scan and jump directly to each merit badge presentation on a mobile device.

Each badge card on the index page should display a QR code that encodes the direct URL to that badge's slide deck:
- Programming: https://kwv.github.io/advancement-university/badges/programming/
- AI: https://kwv.github.io/advancement-university/badges/ai/
- Cybersecurity: https://kwv.github.io/advancement-university/badges/cybersecurity/

Implementation notes:
- Use a lightweight JS QR code library (e.g. qrcode.js via CDN) — no build step needed
- QR codes should render inline on each badge card
- Should be scannable on mobile without needing to zoom
- Consider toggle (show/hide) or always-visible depending on layout impact

title: Add official BSA merit badge page link to each title slide
description:
Add a clickable link AND a QR code to the official BSA merit badge requirements page on each presentation's title slide, so counselors and scouts can scan directly to the source material.

Official URLs:
- AI: https://www.scouting.org/merit-badges/artificial-intelligence/
- Cybersecurity: https://www.scouting.org/merit-badges/cybersecurity/
- Programming: https://www.scouting.org/merit-badges/programming/

Implementation notes:
- Add to the title slide (first slide of each slides.md)
- Render a QR code inline next to or below the 'Boy Scouts of America' line
- Also include a visible hyperlink as fallback for non-mobile viewers: e.g. [Official Requirements ↗](url)
- Use a CDN QR library (e.g. qrcode.js) — already needed for advancement-university-wxn, so share the same dependency
- Keep styling subtle — secondary to the badge title
- All three badges (AI, Cybersecurity, Programming) need updating
